intro: Aceratium breviflorum, commonly known as the short-flowered aceratium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in early spring. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are aromatic when crushed. It is native to regions of southern Europe and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
